snippet: The attacks came despite a large-scale military campaign in the area to root out jihadist groups after the massacre of 31 soldiers last month.
abstract: Militants kill five soldiers and police officers in Egypt’s restive Sinai Peninsula; ability of insurgents to set up their own roadblocks in what is essentially a military zone is stark reminder of government’s faltering efforts to contain attacks that have killed hundreds of soldiers and officers.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MERNA THOMAS

lead_paragraph: The attacks came despite a large-scale military campaign in the area to root out jihadist groups after the massacre of 31 soldiers last month.

headline.main: Militants Kill 5 at Roadblocks in Sinai Region
headline.print_headline: Militants Kill 5 at Roadblocks in Sinai Region
